gurmukhi: sXwm Bey Bgvwn ienY bs dYqn ky ijh qy dl hwry ] Kyl idKwvq hY jg kO idn Qorn mY Ab kMs pCwry ]294]
transliteration: Syaam Bhae Bhagvaan Inai Bas Daitan Ke Jih Te Dal Hdare|| Khel Dikhaavat Hai Jag Kau Din Thoran Mai Ab Kans Pachhdare||294||
translation: Krishna, who had defeated the forces of demons earlier, has now come under the control of gopis; now is exhibiting his amorous play to the world and after a few days, he will overthrow Kansa.294.

gurmukhi: auq jwgq sXwm ieqY gupIAw kib sXwm khY ihq kY sMig qwky ] rIJ rhI iqh pY sB hI ipiK nYnn so Puin kwnHr bwky ]
transliteration: Out Jaagad Syaam Iatai Goupeeaa Kabi Syaam Kahai Hit Kai San(i) Taake|| Reejh Rahiti Hpai Sabh Hipikh(i) Nainan So Phoun(i) Kaahnar Baake||
translation: The poet Shyam says that on one side the gopis are keeping awake and on the other side, Krishna does not get a wink of sleep at night, they are pleased to see Krishna with their eyes;

gurmukhi: pRym CkI n prY ienkO kil kwm bFXo Aiq hI qn vwky ] Kylih pRwqih kwl Bey hm nwih lKY hm kY jn gwky ]295]
transliteration: Prem Chhakina Darai Inkau Kal(i) Kaam Badhyo At(i) Hitan Vaake|| Khelah(i) Praatah(i) Kaal Bhae Ham Naah(i) Lakhai Ham Kai Jan Gad Ke||295||
translation: They are not satisfied merely with love and the lust is increasing in their bodies; while playing with Krishna, the day dawns and they are not conscious about it.295.

gurmukhi: pRwq BXo cuhlwq icrI jljwq iKry bn gwie iCrwnI ] gop jgy piq gop jgXo kib sXwm jgI Aru gopn rwnI ]
transliteration: Praat Bhayo Chuhlaat Chirijaljaat Khire Ban Gade Chhiraanee|| Gop Jage Pat(i) Gop Jagyo Kabi Syaam Jagiar(u) Gopan Raanee||
translation: The day dawned and the sparrows began to chirp; the cows were driven to the forest; the gopas have awakened, Nand has awakened a d the mother Yashoda has also awakened;

gurmukhi: jwg auTy qbhI krunwinD jwg auTXo muslIDr mwnI ] gop gey auq nHwn krY ieh kwnH cly gupIAw inj kwnI ]296]
transliteration: Jaag Outhe Tab-hikarounaanidh Jaag Outhyo Mousleedhar Maanee|| Gop Gad Out Nhaan Darai Eh Kaahn Chale Goupeeaa Nij Kaanee||296||
translation: Krishna also awoke and Balram also awoke; on that side, the gopas went to take bath and on this side Krishna went to gopis.296.

gurmukhi: bwq khy rs kI hs kY nih Aaur kQw rs kI koaU BwKY ] cMcl sRIpq ky Apny diRg moih iqnY bqIAw ieh AwKY ]
transliteration: Baat Kahe Ras Kihas Kai Nah(i)aur Kathaa Ras Kikooo Bhaakhai|| Channdhal Sripal Ke Apne Drig Moh(i) Tinai Bateeaa Eh Aakhai||
translation: The gopis are smilingly busy in amorous talk; alluring the agile Krishna with their eyes gopis say like this;

gurmukhi: bwq n jwnq hors kI rs jwnq so nr jo rs gwKY ] pRIq pVHY kr pRIq kVY rs rIqn cIq suno soeI cwKY ]297]
transliteration: Baat Na Jaanat Horas Kiras Jaanat So Nar Jo Ras Gadkhai|| Preet Padhhai Kar Preet Kadai Ras Reetan Cheet Souno Soichaakhai||297||
translation: “We do not know anything about any other, but this much is surely known to us that he, who drinks the sap, only knows the worth of sap; the depth in love comes only when one falls in love and one feels pleasure in talking about the essence.297.
Speech of gopis addressed to Krishna:

gurmukhi: mIq kho rs rIq sBY hm pRIq BeI sunby bqIAw kI ] Aaur BeI quih dyKin kI qum pRIq BeI hmrI CqIAw kI ]
transliteration: Meet Kaho Ras Reet Sabhai Ham Preet Bhaisounbe Bateeaa Kee|| Aur Bhaituhe Dekhan(i) Kitoum Preet Bhaihamrichhateeaa Kee||
translation: “O friend ! we went to listen about the essence; make us understand the mode of realising the essence; we want to see you and you love the nipples of our teats;”

gurmukhi: rIJ lgI khny muK qy hs suMdr bwq iesI gqIAw kI ] nyh lgXo hir so BeI moCn hoiq ieqI gq hY su qRIAw kI ]298]
transliteration: Reejhlagikahne Moukh Te Has Soundar Baat Isigadeaa|| Neh Lagyo Har(i) So Bhaimochhan Hot(i) Itigad Hai Su Treeaa Kee||298||
translation: The gopis talk such-like things with Krishna and such is the condition of those women that they are becoming unconscious-like in the love of Krishna.298.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI dsm skMD bicqR nwtk kiRSnwvqwry cIr hrn iDAwie ]
transliteration: It(i) Sridasam Sakandh Bachitra Naatak Krishnaavatdare Cheer Haran Dhiaae||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “Stealing of Clothes” in Krishna Avatara (based on Dasham Skandh) in Bachittar Natak.
